content: Is there a reason that Rust NFC normalizes identifiers instead of NFD? The confusable lint, for example, need to convert all identifiers to NFD forms for comparison per https://www.unicode.org/reports/tr39/#Confusable_Detection. Not an Unicode expert and doesn't have a preference, just wondering why
NFC Is "nicer" in that it uses precomposed characters for things like Ã©. NFD(NFC(str)) == NFD(str) anyway, so it doesn't matter too much
